org.berthold.beamCalc

Class Load

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.berthold.beamCalc.Load
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Load>

    public class Load
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Load>
    Load. Defines a single or a line load in [N] acting on a Beam Sign:

    Vertical loads: Force acting downwards (-) Load acting upwards (+). Horizontal force acts to the left (+), force acts to the right (-) Angle in degrees:

    Left side angles range from 0 to -179 deg, counterclokwise. Right side angles range from 0 to 180 deg, clockwise. Samples

    +90 deg. load acting from right to left, horizontally +45 deg. load acting diagonally from upper right to bottom left +135 deg. same as +45 but acting from lower right to upper left A negative load at an angle of 180 deg. is the same as a positive load acting at 0 deg.

    Author:
    Berthold
    See Also:
    Beam

            boolean includeThisLoadIntoCaclulation,
            boolean thisLoadHasAnError)
        Create a load acting on the beam.
        Parameters:
        nameOfLoad - Any name allowed (F1, q1 etc..).
        force_N - The force acting (-) downwards. (+) upwards.
        distanceFromLeftEndOfBeam_m - Position of force acting.
        angleOfLoad_degrees - Angle.
        lengthOfLineLoad_m - Length, if line load.
        includeThisLoadIntoCaclulation - Use where aplicable....
        thisLoadHasAnError - Use where aplicable....
